tags: i’ll get off my soapbox now
now back to entertaining my fam
summary:
here’s something i’ve been thinking about:
we all like to romanticize dnp’s relationship and say things like “omg they really...
body:
here’s something i’ve been thinking about:

we all like to romanticize dnp’s relationship and say things like “omg they really can’t be without each other for more than a day”, and i’m no exception from this. it’s comforting to feel like there’s really a chance to have that kind of a connection with somebody. but i don’t necessarily think it’s true - at least not fully.

dan and phil are two fully grown men in a healthy, committed relationship with each other. they love each other, and they really do enjoy each other’s company. there’s a bit of codependency there, phil’s bursting need to tell dan about his day after only 10 hours apart or dan never getting to eat cheese when phil is home because phil is lactose intolerant, but the world wouldn’t actually come to an end if they spent more than a day apart. or even two weeks.

if something were to happen, if one of them were to get an opportunity in america and have to fly over there whilst the other had to stay and tend to something back in london, it wouldn’t be the end of the world. they chose each other in the beginning of their relationship and they continue to choose each other now, every day, and that’s what makes getting a glimpse of their relationship so lovely.

they aren’t this #goals couple, they’re in a healthy adult relationship. which means that while it may really fucking suck for them when they do have to be apart for longer periods of time sometimes, it’s not the end of the world for them. or for anyone else. they make it work, just like they always have and i’m pretty damn sure they’ll continue to do so.

tldr; it’s okay to love their love. just keep in mind that it’s not nearly as epically romantic as we sometimes make it out to be.

“plus that fuckin owl slide that’s gotta go”

blog.name: two-fond-dorks
blog.title: phil lester you're a genius
blog.description: Sarah, 30ish, NY. Introvert who's still discovering herself. Formerly melapplesphan. (icon by twilightciel)

title: “Duality”
body:
Rating: Explicit

Pairing: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

Summary: During the filming of their 2018 Easter baking video, Phil finds that he can’t stop staring at Dan’s curls and wishing he was wearing his pastel outfit, so he asks Dan to put it on for him. Or, how Phil finally stumbles onto the main reason why he gets so turned on during the late nights he and Dan spend baking. In which Phil has a thing for Pastel Dan, running his fingers through Dan’s curls, and telling Dan he’s beautiful. Equal parts fluff and smut. Please heed the tags.

AN: Why are Dan and Phil always so flirty in their baking videos? Why is there always flour on Phil’s pants? What do they get up to between cuts? Why is Phil staring at Dan’s head so much in the Easter Bunny Biscuits video? These questions and more will be answered.

This is my first foray into Phan smut (though not my first into smut in general). Hopefully I did it justice.

Enjoy!

Duality

(a messy hair gif for reference - gif src)

Dan and Phil start filming their 2018 Easter baking video at two in the morning on a Wednesday. They always film their baking videos around this time of day, though neither of them can explain exactly why this has become their tradition. For whatever reason, the early morning hours just work best for them. Maybe it’s because they’re both night owls and they tend to get their energy when most people are asleep. Maybe it’s because that’s the time of day when they’re at their silliest, which is the perfect recipe for the ridiculousness that is their baking series.

Whatever the reason, it works for them.

In more ways than one.

Because a late night of filming and excessive amounts of sugar doesn’t just end with enough footage for a video.

It also ends with at least one bout of mind-blowing sex….

…because the baking videos never fail to make Phil horny as hell.

“What is it about these videos that makes you so randy?” Dan asks him every time they film one, and Phil never has an answer. He thinks it might be a combination of the late hours and the sugar highs and something else he can’t quite put his finger on that leads to the excessive flirting they barely manage to keep a lid on when they’re filming.

But to be honest, Phil doesn’t really care about the why? of it all, because every night spent filming a baking video is a night spent having sex with Dan, and who is he to question that?

Sometimes they have to stop filming in the middle of a video to have a quickie in the lounge.

Sometimes they can make it until the actual “baking” part of the video, when they wander off to Dan’s room and pass the time together, hurrying back to film some quick and ridiculous dialogue for the “intermission.”

Sometimes they actually manage to make it through to the end of filming.

And sometimes….

…sometimes they don’t actually stop filming.

(read the rest on AO3)

summary: did WE pay for it. i bet they share finances to a certain extent and that makes me,, so demon
question: did WE pay for it. i bet they share finances to a certain extent and that makes me,, so demon
answer:
for context (x)

oh they def do i mean i wouldn’t be shocked if pretty much everything is joint at this point it just makes more sense like even if they weren’t together together (lmao as if) they do literally everything together it honestly would make more sense to have joint everything tbh

anyway i love them saying ‘we’ it makes me happy :)

summary:
Dan saying 'gay teen story' really surprised me tbh and I don't know why lmao
Like,,,I don't think we've heard him saying 'gay'...
body:
Dan saying ‘gay teen story’ really surprised me tbh and I don’t know why lmao

Like,,,I don’t think we’ve heard him saying 'gay’ since the time he read the 'that wig makes you look gay’ comment in that live show
